Ingredients: 

• 10 large flour tortillas (you can adjust the quantity based on your preference) 
\• 2 cups shredded cheese (common options include cheddar, Monterey Jack, or a Mexican cheese blend) 
• 2 cups of your choice of fillings (e.g., cooked chicken, cooked beef, sautéed vegetables, beans, or a combination) 
• 2 tablespoons cooking oil (vegetable oil or cooking spray) 
• Salsa, guacamole, sour cream, or other desired toppings for serving Procedure: 
1. Prepare the Fillings: 
• If you're using meats, ensure they are fully cooked and seasoned to your liking. 
• If you're using vegetables, sauté them until they're tender and season them as desired. 

2. Assemble the Quesadillas: 

• Lay out one flour tortilla on a clean surface. 
• Sprinkle a portion of shredded cheese evenly on one-half of the tortilla. 
• Add a portion of your chosen fillings on top of the cheese. 
• Fold the other half of the tortilla over the cheese and fillings to create a half moon shape. 

3. Cook the Quesadillas: 

• Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium-high heat and add a little cooking oil or use cooking spray. 
• Place the assembled quesadilla in the skillet and cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until the tortilla is golden brown, and the cheese is melted. 

4. Repeat for Additional Quesadillas: 
• Continue making quesadillas using the remaining tortillas, cheese, and fillings, cooking them one at a time or in batches. 

5. Serve: 

• Once each quesadilla is cooked, remove it from the skillet and cut it into wedges. 
• Serve the quesadilla wedges with your choice of toppings, such as salsa, guacamole, and sour cream.



Quesadillas are a versatile dish, and you can get creative with the fillings. You can also make them as simple or as gourmet as you like. Enjoy your homemade quesadillas for 5 members!
